alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Mobile Inland; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 12:52AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MONROE... NORTHEASTERN MOBILE...NORTHWESTERN BALDWIN AND SOUTH CENTRAL CLARKE COUNTIES THROUGH 130 AM CST... At 1251 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Movico, or 11 miles north of Creola, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon and Movico. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Mobile Inland; Monroe
